descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Embedded reporting with science field research teams takes students for four to six weeks in the field to follow the retreat of the glaciers in Mongolia and Greenland, the impact of rising sea levels in the Yucatan and the source of much-needed thunderstorms on the Great Plains (a detective search that involved more than 100 scientists and teams from NOAA and NASA). Students also join science research facilities at CERN, in Munich and New Zealand and at other locations. This two-credit capstone course begins with seminars on field reporting strategies and on building narrative and visual stories from field experiences, sources and data. We also pitch stories in advance to major media partners prior to your departure. You file blogs, photos and stories for publication from the field. Once you return, you produce major in-depth narrative stories with photos and graphics and/or multimedia stories, working closely with your instructor. Students choosing to embed at a Washington D.C. site such as NIH can complete story production in D.C. or return to Chicago. We have some funding for embedded reporting to help offset travel expenses.
